location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 1229 of 1826 from William Newnham, Secretary to the Governor of Bombay, Bombay Castle, to Captain Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire

mods.abstract: William Newnham acknowledges the Resident's letters numbers 62 and 64 dated 27 and 28 September which reported his visit to the Arab coast and his conversation with the Imam of Muscat in relation to the affairs of the Persian Gulf and the Shaikh of Bushire. He informs that the Governor of Bombay, Mountstuart Elphinstone, approves of the Resident's proceedings and encloses a translation of a letter from the ex-Governor of Bushire, Abdoor Russool Khan [‘Abd al-Rasūl Khān], and the Governor of Bombay's reply.
